ratings.comment: Such a fun professor! You can tell how much he cares about student learning and progress. The class itself felt very comfortable, and Andrew is great at conversing with students (he even encouraged us to address him using informal pronouns). As long as you do the work, it's an easy A. I would definitely recommend him as a professor!

Andrew is great! I took French 301 and 302 with him. He is extremely helpful with improving spoken French, and he is great with keeping a conversation going. He is very enthusiastic, and one of the best I've had at UW!

Andrew is one of the best professors I've ever had at UW.  I took this as well as 301, so I saw him a lot each week. He's really easy to talk to and super helpful. 322 had a lot of work and readings, and he was a tough grader at times, but if you do the work it'll be ok.  He schedules the semester so finals time are a breeze for this class.
Come, eat, talk, get an A. It's insanely easy but great for anyone who wants to speak practical French (not textbook French).

I found this class very challenging, engaging, and fun. But the people who weren't ready for class probably weren't as happy since you got put on the spot sometimes. Andrew has a ton of energy and his French is amazing. Plus he really cares.

After having studied abroad, I was extremely disappointed with this class.  Although Andrew's written French is good, his oral is not impressive and he often makes simple grammatical mistakes.  He's a nice guy and he wants to engage the class, but he only succeeded in doing so once or twice the whole semester.  I don't recommend him for this class.
Made class extremely entertaining and made it fun to be learning French.  Highly recommend.  Andrew rocks!

AMAZING PROFESSOR!  Everyday was fun even though we learned tons of stuff.  Tests and exams are really easy and Andrew grades them very generously. This class has lots of verb tenses and grammar, but he will get you through it with ease.  TAKE THIS CLASS!

Professor Irving is an outstanding french teacher. He is great at connecting to his students and is very helpful. You will learn a lot about french in this class, and it won't even seem that difficult. Great prof, take this class.
Most fantastic class in the world! Come, eat, & be merry. So easy-going - Andrew comes and sits right next to you & strikes up a conversation!
This professor is awesome.  He is very helpful and is excited to teach young French speakers.  Plus he is funnny.
Come 4 days a week to the French house, eat, talk French, and get an A. That's it. Yum.

EASIEST FRENCH CLASS I HAVE EVER TAKEN! Prof. Irving ROCKS he explains everthing really well. The quizes are easy he grades them even easier than they are and assigns projects that he basically gives EVERYONE A's on. Take this class if you can hello how are you in french.
Easiest French class I've ever taken. A little too much grammar, but projects are easy and grading is even easier! Great for getting some easy retro credits and then switching to another language.

Andrew really made the class enjoyable. He's very easy to talk to, and he really does his best to keep it interesting (although sometimes the class is a little grammar-heavy). Also, he's a very easy grader!

If you are awesome in French, then he's really nice.  But if you are struggling, you have a problem.  I kept going to him for help and he would brush me off or tell me to just study more.  But, like I said, if you are good at french, the test are fair (mostly vocab).

i LOVED this class, and i don't like french all that much. andrew is an awesome easy-going guy. his quizzes and tests aren't bad at all, and he doesn't really care about attendance. plus, he'll usually give you the benefit of the doubt when grading. oh, and don't worry about it being an honors class
